title.narrative: LOCAL Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SUPPLY AND DEMAND

description.narrative: Strengthened support for children and families to sustainable use of drinking water and the adoption of good practices in sanitation and hygiene including in humanitarian situation, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Pregnant women, nursing mothers, and children under 5 have access and use equitable public and community facilities for the prevention and treatment of malnutrition, including in humanitarian situations

sector.narrative: Education and training in water supply and sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened support for children and families to sustainable use of drinking water and the adoption of good practices in sanitation and hygiene including in humanitarian situation

description.narrative: Sanitation marketing continued its steady progress with 67% of poorer households (or 5% of all households in the project areas) benefiting from an improved toilet with direct support from UNICEF. Progress of WASH in institutions were restrained due to the CO, and the country at large, focusing on the Kenneth cyclone humanitarian assistance. As WASH co-lead and WASH main humanitarian actor, UNICEF worked with government, state company and civil society organizations to provide emergency water supply to 74 078 people (35 111 men and 38 967 women). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of school with water supply
Number of schools with water and sanitation facilities separated for girls and boys that meet national standards and are have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
Within project area, poor households (as defined by communities) with access to, and awarness of, improved sanitation products
"Improved Sanitation" communication campaign implemented on a national scale
